text: Is Julia Nightly literally updated each night or by some other interval? (Tests for one of my packages failed on nightly but I can't reproduce them locally so I'd like to retrigger the github actions tests, but not until I'm sure it has a newer nightly.)

elements.text: Is Julia Nightly literally updated each night or by some other interval? (Tests for one of my packages failed on nightly but I can't reproduce them locally so I'd like to retrigger the github actions tests, but not until I'm sure it has a newer nightly.)

text: Thanks. Shouldn't have to be a long wait then. On the other hand it's not very likely that it differed noticeably from my local version.

elements.text: Thanks. Shouldn't have to be a long wait then. On the other hand it's not very likely that it differed noticeably from my local version.

text: But yeah, it could be a packaging thing compared to a local source build. I'll try to download the nightly build myself, which was probably what you were trying to tell me. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: But yeah, it could be a packaging thing compared to a local source build. I'll try to download the nightly build myself, which was probably what you were trying to tell me.

text: That did indeed fail like CI. Great, now I can debug it.

elements.text: That did indeed fail like CI. Great, now I can debug it.

text:
There may be a slight delay between the CI nightly and the binary you download yourself due to caching. I don't know the details of it though.

You can enable versioninfo printing for nightlies and then build from the exact commit it used to debug in the future: <https://github.com/julia-actions/setup-julia#versioninfo>

elements.text:

text: Looks like the Julia embedding example is no longer working with the nightly binaries and neither is my package. Yes, I know where to search for the suspect.
